alert.note: Alert for Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 28 at 5:31PM CDT until May 28 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN NORTON COUNTY... At 530 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 10 miles south of Wilsonville, or 13 miles northwest of Norton, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. Multiple spotters have reported funnel clouds from this storm. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Norton County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
